Macros

#define BSP_VID_DEC_DEV_PER_PORT_MAX   (2U)
 Max devices that can be associated with a single VIP port.
 
#define BSP_VID_DEC_DEFAULT   ((UInt32) 0xFFFFFFFFU)
 Value to use, when it is needed to apply device specific default setting value.
 
#define BSP_VID_DEC_NO_CHANGE   ((UInt32) 0xFFFFFFFEU)
 Value to use, when it is needed to NOT change a device specific setting value.
 
#define BSP_VID_DEC_GPIO_NONE   ((UInt32) 0xFFFFFFFFU)
 Value to use, when there no GPIO is used for device reset.

 Video system. More...
 

Detailed Description

This modules define API to capture video data using external video decoders like TVP5158, TVP7002. Typically the external video decoders interface to the host via one of the VIP ports. I2C is used to send control commands to the video decoder.

User application controls and configures the video decoder and based on this in turn configures the VIP port.

The following video decoder's are currently supported

  • TVP5158 - Multi-CH NTSC/PAL video decoder
  • TVP7002 - Component HD video decoder
  • SII9127 - HDMI HD video decoder
  • ADV7611 - HDMI HD video decoder

The API interface used in the FVID2 interface (See also FVID2 API)

The following FVID2 APIs are supported by video decoder device drivers,

  • Creating the driver - Fvid2_create()
    Parameter Value
    drvId FVID2_VID_DEC_TVP5158_DRV
    FVID2_VID_DEC_TVP7002_DRV
    FVID2_VID_DEC_SII9127_DRV
    FVID2_VID_DEC_ADV7611_DRV
    instanceId Set to 0
    createArgs Bsp_VidDecCreateParams *
    createStatusArgs Bsp_VidDecCreateStatus *
    cbParams NOT USED, Set to NULL.
    Fvid2_Handle returned by Fvid2_create() is used in subsequent FVID2 APIs
  • Deleting the driver - Fvid2_delete()
    Parameter Value
    deleteArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
  • Starting the driver - Fvid2_start()
    Parameter Value
    cmdArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
  • Stopping the driver - Fvid2_stop()
    Parameter Value
    cmdArgs NOT USED, set to NULL
  • Controlling the driver - Fvid2_control()
    See External Video Decoder IOCTL's for the list of IOCTLs supported by the driver.
    All supported video decoders implement these IOCTLs.

  • TVP5158 supports further additional specific IOCTLs (See TVP5158 Video Decoder API)
  • SII9153 and TVP7002 do not support any additional specific IOCTLs.

Typicall API calling sequence for video decoder in context of video capture application would be like below

  • Fvid2_create() - create the video decoder device handle
  • IOCTL_BSP_VID_DEC_GET_CHIP_ID - check if device is active
  • IOCTL_BSP_VID_DEC_RESET - reset it
  • IOCTL_BSP_VID_DEC_SET_VIDEO_MODE - setup the device for a particular mode
  • IOCTL_BSP_VID_DEC_GET_VIDEO_STATUS - check if video source is detected
  • Create capture driver based on video decoder setup and video decoder status.
  • Start capture driver
  • Fvid2_start() - enable video decoder to start data output to VIP capture port
  • Do video capture using capture driver.
  • Stop capture driver
  • Fvid2_stop() - disable video decoder device
  • Fvid2_delete() - delete video decoder device
  • Delete the capture driver

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum Bsp_VidDecVideoSystem

Video system.

Enumerator
BSP_VID_DEC_VIDEO_SYSTEM_NTSC 

Interlaced, NTSC system, 720x240 per field.

BSP_VID_DEC_VIDEO_SYSTEM_PAL 

Interlaced, PAL system, 720x288 per field.

BSP_VID_DEC_VIDEO_SYSTEM_AUTO_DETECT 

Auto-detect NTSC or PAL system.

BSP_VID_DEC_VIDEO_SYSTEM_NONE 

Neither NTSC nor PAL system.

BSP_VID_DEC_VIDEO_SYSTEM_MAX 

Max video system
